intro: Melicope octandra, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. It is often found in coastal and lowland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
